bibl.title: English translation [from French] of letter from [s.n.] Carde to Frederick F. Russell, October 15, 1923

div1.p: Carde sends Russell copies of reports concerning the yellow fever epidemic in the Sudan, the Ivory Coast, and Dahomey.

div1.head: English translation [from French] of letter from [s.n.] Carde to Frederick F. Russell, October 15, 1923 (See French original.)
div1.opener:
HvW-MFW
11/12/23
TRANSLATED FROM THE FRENCH
GENERAL GOVERNMENT
OF
FRENCH WEST AFRICA
Dakar, October 15, 1923.
--------
Dr. Russell,
General Director
61 Broadway, New York.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Pursuant to your letter of July 12, and in accordance with your
desire, I take pleasure in sending you copies of

Three reports by Dr. Seguin in connection with the yellow fever epi-
demic which invaded Ségou (Soudan) during the months of October and No-
vember 1922.

Two reports by Dr. Bauvallet on the epidemic at Grand-Bassam during
August and September 1922.

Two reports by Dr. Ferris referring to a small epidemic at Ouidah
(Dahomey) in June 1923.

May I ask you not to publish any of these documents which,
in my thought, are only for the purpose of assisting the scientists of
your institute in their researches on yellow fever.

Should the disease make its appearance again, or should
there even be a suspected case in French West Africa, I shall be glad
to send you, for the same purpose as I have done it before, the in-
formation collected by the health department.
